feature_name: Hub beta sidekick naming and label language hotfix
scope_summary: Rename visible Hub beta behavior labels to named sidekicks and replace persona wording in user-facing copy while preserving existing internal mode keys.

legal_and_regulatory.rationale: No policy/legal terms changed and no new regulated claims added.

privacy_local_first_promise.rationale: Only display strings changed; storage keys and local-only behavior are unchanged.
evidence: No network or telemetry code touched

medical_scope_and_claims.rationale: No medical guidance or diagnostic language introduced.

behavioral_science_alignment.rationale: Named sidekicks reduce interpretation overhead versus abstract labels.
evidence: Behavior mode copy replaced with Choose a sidekick

neurodivergence_research_alignment.rationale: Concrete naming lowers cognitive load and reduces ambiguity in mode selection.
evidence: Stats panel now says Sidekick selected
No additional choices added; still four options

user_benefit_and_harm_check.rationale: Benefit is clarity and consistency; risk is minimal because logic and persistence are unchanged.
evidence: Only text labels and bundle hash changed
Source tests and production build passed before deploy sync

brand_voice_and_claims.rationale: Copy is direct and concrete, matching sidekick language guidance.
evidence: Removed Persona selected and Behavior mode text

accessibility_and_inclusion.rationale: Control count and interaction patterns are unchanged, and naming is more literal.
evidence: ARIA label updated from Persona to Sidekicks

security_and_reliability.rationale: Rebuilt from clean source commit and synced bundle/index references together.
evidence: No JavaScript runtime logic changes to storage schema

monetization_and_dark_pattern_check.rationale: No paywall or conversion flows changed.

ship_decision.conditions: Ship and verify /hub/beta loads with named sidekick chips and no persona wording in visible labels.
